dt: {bc}something supplied for convenience or to satisfy a need: such as
{bc}lodging, food, and services or traveling space and related services
{bc}a public conveyance (such as a train) that stops at all or nearly all points
{bc}the act of {d_link|accommodating|accommodate} someone or something {bc}the state of being accommodated: such as
{bc}the providing of what is needed or desired for convenience

dt.t: changed his schedule for the {wi}accommodation{/wi} of his clients
Negotiators felt that an {wi}accommodation{/wi} with the union was possible.

dt: {bc}the automatic adjustment of the eye for seeing at different distances effected chiefly by changes in the convexity of the crystalline lens
{bc}the range over which such adjustment is possible

et: borrowed from Middle French & Latin; Middle French, borrowed from Latin {it}accommodātiōn-, accommodātiō{/it} "act of fitting or adapting, willingness to oblige," from {it}accommodāre{/it} "to {et_link|accommodate|accommodate}" + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō{/it}, suffix of action nouns
shortdef: something supplied for convenience or to satisfy a need: such as
lodging, food, and services or traveling space and related services —usually used in plural
a public conveyance (such as a train) that stops at all or nearly all points
